intro: Lachenalia membranacea, commonly known as the parchment lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant features fleshy, basal leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It produces showy, bell-shaped blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Lachenalia membranacea is commonly cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
